TopicTitle: Girlfriend just broke up with me :(

Articles.Content: Perfect time to play KSP! keep my mind off of it....

You will have a lot of time to play now, my friend, you will loose all human interaction and end up with the only link to humans through the forum.

Seriously though, Sorry to hear that, never nice when it happens, so I hear...
I'm sorry to hear that. Hopefully you'll find a new one soon, preferably one that shares your interest in launching little green people into the Mun.

I'm sorry to hear that. Hopefully you'll find a new one soon, preferably one that shares your interest in launching little green people into the Mun.

That sounds almost to good to be true...

That sounds almost to good to be true...

And it is.

A friend of mine always said "I want a girlfriend that likes video games so we can play together" and we were always "nah, that's never gonna happen". And guest what? It happened... and it wasn't pretty at all.

After some time he was like "why can't she play alone?!". There are things you don't like to do with your girlfriend, you know, having some "me" time. And if your "me" time is playing games, then you're screwed: you can't say "no, I don't want to play with you"!

And it is.

A friend of mine always said "I want a girlfriend that likes video games so we can play together" and we were always "nah, that's never gonna happen". And guest what? It happened... and it wasn't pretty at all.

After some time he was like "why can't she play alone?!". There are things you don't like to do with your girlfriend, you know, having some "me" time. And if your "me" time is playing games, then you're screwed: you can't say "no, I don't want to play with you"!

FYI that's not all women who play games.

It's not impossible to find a girl who likes games but will also give you space.

Just say "I'd like to play some games by myself." And if she says "No, we have to play together" or "You don't love me?" or something like that, then she's just getting a bit clingy really. Explain to her how you feel about it and that you need some time alone.

I'm friends with a decent number of men and women who are like this (as in willing to give space; also, I've dated a few of the women).
Aww that sucks... I had a girlfriend once... When i was 15... and now we're just friends.
I've never had a breakup, but I have had girls move away, so I know what it feels like. May you find a woman who will be your perfect match.

I've never had a breakup, but I have had girls move away, so I know what it feels like. May you find a woman who will be your perfect match.

Same here. *sigh* It sucks no doubt. Of course, she wasn't actually my girlfriend. She was just a really good friend who I was attracted to.

I'm sorry to hear that.

You'll find another girl that loves you soon.

The best advice I ever had when breaking up was:

"Go Launch ten more missions to the Moon"

Git'r'done
Launch a rocket. Name it after your ex. Crash it into the mun. FEEL BETTER.

Ah, yes. I remember my high school girlfriends. It's a darn good thing I didn't marry any of them!

Seriously, though. Keep your head high. Relationships will get better as you get older.

Ah, yes. I remember my high school girlfriends. It's a darn good thing I didn't marry any of them!

OMG THIS!!!!111111.

Seriously bro, she did you a favor.
